title: GHQ 12 vs SPOVI-14
url: "/compare-harmonise-instruments/ghq-12-vs-spovi-14/"
date: 2025-02-07
---

## GHQ 12 vs SPOVI-14

Psychologists and social science researchers often need to compare different sets of questionnaire items, such as the ones in the 12-item General Health Questionnaire (GHQ 12) and the Specific Phobia of Vomiting Inventory (SPOVI-14). This comparison, also known as harmonisation, can often be a labor-intensive and subjective process. But what if this process could be made easier, faster, and more objective? This is where a tool like Harmony comes into play. For instance, when comparing GHQ 12 vs SPOVI-14, Harmony can be an invaluable asset. Harmony utilizes cutting-edge natural language processing and artificial intelligence models to help researchers perform harmonisation of questionnaire items even in different languages. With Harmony, researchers can prepare for, carry out, and assess the results of the GHQ 12 vs SPOVI-14 comparison with ease and efficiency. The software can select instruments from its database or users can upload their own in PDF format. This feature gives psychologists the flexibility they need when comparing GHQ 12 vs SPOVI-14 or any other pair of psychological instruments. Moreover, the Harmony software doesn't just simplify the harmonization process, but it also removes much of its subjectivity. How? Powerful AI models provide a percentage match between each item in the GHQ 12 and SPOVI-14, providing more objective comparative data. So, if you are a psychologist or a researcher looking to effectively and efficiently compare GHQ 12 vs SPOVI-14 or any other pair of psychological instruments, give Harmony a try. Its advanced, user-friendly, and multi-lingual features are designed to make your work easier and better.
